intro: Caiophora boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet or purple flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically broad and ovate, with a smooth texture. Caiophora boliviana is often found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous areas.
